intro: Sutera carvalhoi, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or red when ripe. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Sutera carvalhoi is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and pleasant scent.
